summary: I conduct research about how to improve customer and user experiences. I am equally adept at quantitative and qualitative research, excel at writing, and bring a passion for finding user-centered ways of communicating research insights.

projects.title: European Influence Index
projects.description: Ongoing project to build an index that measures foreign influence capacity between states in both absolute and relative terms, with a specific focus on the capacity for influence within asymmetrical, interdependent relationships. The index will then be used to measure and analyze the influence both of individual European states as well as of the European Union as a whole. This is a joint project between The Hague Center for Strategic Studies (HCSS), the Frederick S. Pardee Center for International Futures, and the European Union Institute for Security Studies (EUISS).

projects.title: Global Parliament of Mayors
projects.description: Co-authored two background papers for the Global Parliament of Mayors: "The City & the Interdependent World", on governance through inter-city cooperation, and "The City & Nature", on city strategies to adapt to and mitigate the effects of climate change

contributors.headline: Helping improve services for residents and entrepreneurs in the city of the Hague

projects.title: "Multilingual MetaFore: The Future of the International Security Environment in Different Languages" in the 2016 StratMon Report, "The Wheel of Fortune"
projects.description: Multilingual MetaFore is a methodology for meta-foresight that in this report strives to assess how leading experts and sources from around the world perceive future security opportunities and challenges. An international team spread over ten countries collected and coded 483 recent foresight studies written in six languages (Chinese, Russian, Farsi, Arabic, Turkish, and English). Amalgamating the results of the coding then allows us to analyze, visualize, and compare the views on the future of global security within and across different foresight communities in a more systematic way than any more traditionally discursive analysis ever could.

contributors.headline: Helping improve services for residents and entrepreneurs in the city of the Hague

projects.title: Demographic Trends among B1/B2 Visa Applicants
projects.description: Used qualitative and quantitative research methods to analyze information about B1/B2 visa holders in order to determine patterns in visa use and summarized findings in a diplomatic cable that was sent to Washington as well as the Beijing Embassy and other U.S. Consulates in China.

contributors.headline: Helping improve services for residents and entrepreneurs in the city of the Hague

projects.title: Gender Presentation and Assessments of Authority
projects.description: Conducted 15 hours of observation of student group meetings in addition to in depth interviews with 5 students in order to analyze the effect of an individual's gender presentation on others' assessment of that person's authority and ability. Project included developing interview questions, transcribing interviews and observations, coding data, and conducting qualitative data analysis.

profile_positions.description:
•	Analyzed and synthesized data from Forrester’s European Customer Experience Index
•	Authored Forrester’s European Customer Experience Index reports, together with an industry analyst from each of the industries covered by the index
•	Advised colleagues on survey design, application of quantitative research methods, and how to analyze and present quantitative data in an accurate and clear way
profile_positions.title: Data Researcher

profile_positions.description:
•	Conducted research in the area of customer experience and user experience, e.g., practical ways to get emotion in customer journeys right; how to enable employees to provide the right experience; or the drivers that contribute to making something the right experience
•	Authored or co-authored 20+ published research reports, with actionable recommendations on how to improve CX; contributed to many more reports, blog posts, and other deliverables
•	Conducted more than 100 in-depth interviews with CX/UX professionals; done focus groups with consumers; analyzed hundreds of responses posed to Forrester’s online consumer community forum; contributed to Forrester’s Digital Experience Review (DXR) evaluations of mobile apps; and managed ad hoc surveys
•	Conducted secondary research using industry sources, including systematic assessments of companies’ strategies, analyzing Forrester Technographics data, and data from Forrester’s European Customer Experience Index
•	Helped build and deliver presentations for Forrester events, consulting, conferences, webinars, etc., and delivered a speech for Forrester’s annual Customer Experience Europe, Middle East, and Arica (EMEA) Forum
•	Improved and streamlined the onboarding of new research colleagues to help them quickly become settled in the company and effective in their roles 
•	Coached and mentored new research associates 
•	Won a collaboration award for working cross-functionally and on tight deadlines to produce high quality research that generated hundreds of sales leads
profile_positions.title: Researcher, CX/UX

profile_positions.description: · Compiled information on Dutch policies related to childcare, dependent care (including of the sick/ elderly), and employment regimes

profile_positions.description:

·	Co-authored 4 published reports and collaborated on 5 additional projects, with tasks including visualizing data, writing literature reviews, and developing coding schemes for content analysis
·	Conducted primary research and secondary research and assisted with developing quantitative and qualitative research designs 
·	Proposed concrete action points in the position papers for the Global Parliament of Mayors that were ratified by attending mayors as opt-in actions for member cities
